text: Urban Clifford "Urbie" Green (August 8, 1926December 31, 2018) was an American jazz trombonist. He toured with Woody Herman, Gene Krupa, Jan Savitt, and Frankie Carle.[ Allmusic] The 1980s and beyond saw a slowing down of Urbie Green's recording career. Both albums recorded by him during this period are live, straight jazz works; Just Friends, and Sea Jam Blues. In 1995 he was elected into the Alabama Jazz Hall of Fame. Green died in Hellertown, Pennsylvania from congestive heart failure on December 31, 2018, aged 92. ==References== ==Other websites== *â€“ Official Web Site *Urbie Green at the Trombone Page of the World * A Tribute to Urbie Green *Biography at Alabama Jazz Hall of Fame *Biography at WindSong Press *Profile at Verve Music *Official website of the Alabama Jazz Hall of Fame * * Category:1926 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:American jazz musicians Category:American trombonists Category:Musicians from Pennsylvania Category:Musicians from Alabama Category:People from Mobile, Alabama
title: Urbie Green
